solution_line_template: He earn ${refurbished_tshirt_cost} x {num_refurbished_tshirts_sold} = $<<{refurbished_tshirt_cost}*{num_refurbished_tshirts_sold}={income_refurbished_tshirts}>>{income_refurbished_tshirts} for the refurbished T-shirt.
He can earn ${original_tshirt_cost} x {num_tshirts_sold} = $<<{original_tshirt_cost}*{num_tshirts_sold}={income_tshirts}>>{income_tshirts} for the T-shirts.
He can earn ${pants_cost} x {num_pants_sold} = $<<{pants_cost}*{num_pants_sold}={income_pants}>>{income_pants} for the pants.
He can earn ${skirts_cost} x {num_skirts_sold} = $<<{skirts_cost}*{num_skirts_sold}={income_skirts}>>{income_skirts} for the skirts.

Therefore Karl can earn a total of ${income_refurbished_tshirts} + ${income_tshirts} + ${income_pants} + ${income_skirts} = $<<{income_refurbished_tshirts}+{income_tshirts}+{income_pants}+{income_skirts}={total_income}>>{total_income}.
